body_text:
Hello lovely humans,
eslint-plugin-react just published its new version 6.2.0.

  
    
      State
    
    
      Update 🚀
    
  
  
    
      Dependency
    
    
      eslint-plugin-react
    
  
  
    
      New version
    
    
      6.2.0
    
  
  
    
      Type
    
    
      devDependency
    
  

This version is not covered by your current version range.
Without accepting this pull request your project will work just like it did before. There might be a bunch of new features, fixes and perf improvements that the maintainers worked on for you though.
I recommend you look into these changes and try to get onto the latest version of eslint-plugin-react.
Given that you have a decent test suite, a passing build is a strong indicator that you can take advantage of these changes by merging the proposed change into your project. Otherwise this branch is a great starting point for you to work on the update.
Do you have any ideas how I could improve these pull requests? Did I report anything you think isn’t right?
Are you unsure about how things are supposed to work?
There is a collection of frequently asked questions and while I’m just a bot, there is a group of people who are happy to teach me new things. Let them know.
Good luck with your project ✨
You rock!
🌴

GitHub Release
Added

Adds no-unused-prop-types rule (#226 @EvNaverniouk)
Add style-prop-object rule (#715 @petersendidit)
Add auto fix for self-closing-comp (#770 @pl12133)
Add support for typeAnnotations in sort-comp (#235 @dozoisch)
Add support for PureComponent in prefer-stateless-function (#781 @tiemevanveen)

Fixed

Fix jsx-uses-vars to work better with prefer-const. You'll need to upgrade to ESLint 3.4.0 to completely fix the compatibility issue (#716)
Fix require-render-return crash (#784)
Fix related components detection in prop-types (#735)
Fix component detection to ignore functions expression without a parent component

Changed

Update dependencies
Documentation improvements (@lencioni)


The new version differs by 13 commits .

80fd8e1 Update CHANGELOG and bump version
953e858 Add test to check jsx-uses-vars and prefer-const compatibility (#716)
33a3516 Update dependencies
ed1f168 Adds no-unused-prop-types rule (fixes #226)
466bb5e Fix require-render-return crash (fixes #784)
7024678 Add PureComponent support to prefer-stateless-function
d4dee48 Fix jsx-uses-vars to work better with prefer-const (fixes #716)
70bf28d Fix component detection to ignore functions expression without a parent component
7ed3b29 Add style-prop-object rule (fixes #715)
8ea2d0e Fix related components detection in prop-types (fixes #735)
4be546a Add backticks to jsx-no-target-blank heading
d89bc05 Add auto fix for self-closing-comp
3a8bf42 Add support for typeAnnotations in sort-comp (fixes #235)

See the full diff.

This pull request was created by greenkeeper.io.
Tired of seeing this sponsor message? ⚡️ greenkeeper upgrade

eslint-plugin-react just published its new version 6.2.0.

This version is not covered by your current version range.

Without accepting this pull request your project will work just like it did before. There might be a bunch of new features, fixes and perf improvements that the maintainers worked on for you though.

I recommend you look into these changes and try to get onto the latest version of eslint-plugin-react.
Given that you have a decent test suite, a passing build is a strong indicator that you can take advantage of these changes by merging the proposed change into your project. Otherwise this branch is a great starting point for you to work on the update.

Good luck with your project ✨

The new version differs by 13 commits .

  • 3a8bf42 Add support for typeAnnotations in sort-comp (fixes #235)

title: Update eslint-plugin-react to version 6.2.0 🚀
body:
Hello lovely humans, [eslint-plugin-react](https://www.npmjs.com/package/eslint-plugin-react) just published its new version 6.2.0.
State Update :rocket:
Dependency eslint-plugin-react
New version 6.2.0
Type devDependency
This version is **not covered** by your **current version range**. Without accepting this pull request your project will work just like it did before. There might be a bunch of new features, fixes and perf improvements that the maintainers worked on for you though. I recommend you look into these changes and try to get onto the latest version of eslint-plugin-react. Given that you have a decent test suite, a passing build is a strong indicator that you can take advantage of these changes by merging the proposed change into your project. Otherwise this branch is a great starting point for you to work on the update. Do you have any ideas how I could improve these pull requests? Did I report anything you think isn’t right? Are you unsure about how things are supposed to work? There is a collection of [frequently asked questions](https://greenkeeper.io/faq.html) and while I’m just a bot, there is a group of people who are happy to teach me new things. [Let them know](https://github.com/greenkeeperio/greenkeeper/issues/new). Good luck with your project :sparkles: You rock! :palm_tree: --- [GitHub Release](https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/releases/tag/v6.2.0)

Added

  • Adds no-unused-prop-types rule (#226 @EvNaverniouk)
  • Add style-prop-object rule (#715 @petersendidit)
  • Add auto fix for self-closing-comp (#770 @pl12133)
  • Add support for typeAnnotations in sort-comp (#235 @dozoisch)
  • Add support for PureComponent in prefer-stateless-function (#781 @tiemevanveen)

Fixed

  • Fix jsx-uses-vars to work better with prefer-const. You'll need to upgrade to ESLint 3.4.0 to completely fix the compatibility issue (#716)
  • Fix require-render-return crash (#784)
  • Fix related components detection in prop-types (#735)
  • Fix component detection to ignore functions expression without a parent component

Changed

  • Update dependencies
  • Documentation improvements (@lencioni)
--- The new version differs by 13 commits . - [`80fd8e1`](https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/commit/80fd8e16c1640626ed694f78166f03d19208b366) Update CHANGELOG and bump version - [`953e858`](https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/commit/953e858ce7d7e07d4366fa6b8dde79092abc3cb0) Add test to check jsx-uses-vars and prefer-const compatibility (#716) - [`33a3516`](https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/commit/33a35163bf5b49e6172bbc9271eef0a31e21f3e7) Update dependencies - [`ed1f168`](https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/commit/ed1f168132c125fa596e71adf6d3926adc2691dd) Adds no-unused-prop-types rule (fixes #226) - [`466bb5e`](https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/commit/466bb5ecfcc80b107b7b6dc5686e91f3674f08b9) Fix require-render-return crash (fixes #784) - [`7024678`](https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/commit/7024678853b5e2650ccf9c1df33d20e2120b6450) Add PureComponent support to prefer-stateless-function - [`d4dee48`](https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/commit/d4dee487b92aebe7377a38cb6493c44ebc3569b8) Fix jsx-uses-vars to work better with prefer-const (fixes #716) - [`70bf28d`](https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/commit/70bf28d89eae53b53e3bf41c4bae84cb8700f984) Fix component detection to ignore functions expression without a parent component - [`7ed3b29`](https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/commit/7ed3b29427480c2f19e62b3081a3d8b61ad29de0) Add style-prop-object rule (fixes #715) - [`8ea2d0e`](https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/commit/8ea2d0e2d1769ce243780739e4f01a56367ef39a) Fix related components detection in prop-types (fixes #735) - [`4be546a`](https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/commit/4be546ab333b100458f89c33570d114e7e20a1d5) Add backticks to jsx-no-target-blank heading - [`d89bc05`](https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/commit/d89bc05c4f7be6e4e07eeb99aa67020cafb87fe8) Add auto fix for self-closing-comp - [`3a8bf42`](https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/commit/3a8bf42e1c3b6c434d95d708e24103db4a87f1b2) Add support for typeAnnotations in sort-comp (fixes #235) See the [full diff](https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/compare/055ea4d45c6a08d473815b4d88fb93ab70916f1a...80fd8e16c1640626ed694f78166f03d19208b366). --- This pull request was created by [greenkeeper.io](https://greenkeeper.io/).
